articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Malta
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Malta
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to George Abela, president of Malta, on Sept. 15 on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message extended congratulations to the president and the people of Malta and wished it development and prosperity.

articles.title: Chinese Forestry Administration Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese Forestry Administration Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the State Forestry Administration of China led by its Vice-Director Chen Shuxian arrived here today.

articles.title: DPRK-Italy Friendship Photo Exhibition Held
articles.content:
DPRK-Italy Friendship Photo Exhibition Held
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-Italy friendship photo exhibition was opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Monday.
					 Present there were Ryu Sung Rim, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Italy Friendship Association, its members, officials concerned, working people in the city, staff members of Italian embassy here and the members of the Italian delegation for publishing album on a visit to the DPRK.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, members of the international organisation missions. 
					
					 Speakers referred to the fact that the photo exhibition was opened on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Italy. 
					
					 They stressed that the two countries have cooperated with each other in various fields including culture, adding that they would endeavor for the development of the friendly relations in the future, too.
					
					 The participants looked round photos introducing the history, culture and others of the DPRK and Italy.

articles.title: Reception Given by UK Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by UK Ambassador
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Peter Hughes, UK ambassador to the DPRK, Monday arranged a reception as regards the friendly matches now under way on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and UK.
					 Present there were the visiting Middlesbrough Football Club Ladies' Team, UK, and staff members of the UK embassy and other British guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Also there on invitation were Son Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials concerned, players of the April 25 Women's Football Team and football veterans who created a stir in the world football circle after advancing to quarterfinals for the first time in Asian history during the 8th World Cup.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: DPRK Prove Successful at World Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Prove Successful at World Championships
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Yun Kum Ju bagged a gold medal in the 57kg category event at the 2010 World Female Boxing Championships held in Barbados from September 6 to 19.
					 Kim Hye Song bagged a silver medal in the 54kg category event.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK weightlifters garnered three gold, three silver medals and two bronze medals at the 2010 World Weightlifting Championships now under way in Turkey.
					
					 Kim Un Guk came first in total points and grabbed two gold medals and a silver medal by finishing first with 147kg in snatch and placing second with 173kg in clean and jerk in the men's 62kg category event.
					
					 Pak Hyon Suk bagged a gold medal by lifting 103kg in snatch in the women's 58kg category event while Jong Chun Mi finished third in total points to receive a silver medal by lifting 130kg in clean and jerk.
					
					 Cha Kum Chol finished third in total points by coming second in snatch in the men's 56kg category event.

articles.title: New Protein Feed Resources Available
articles.content:
New Protein Feed Resources Available
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Teachers of Pyongyang University of Agriculture attached to Kim Il Sung University have found out new protein-rich feed resources -- fruits of a tree belonging to Aceraceae.
					 Six years after planting, the tree begins to bear fruits. Its seed is higher than pea and broad bean in the crude protein content. The epicarp also contains some eight percent of crude protein.
					
					 The tree is good not only in acquiring feed materials for stockbreeding and fish farming but in garbing the country in green.
					
					 1.4-6 tons of fruits can be harvested from a hectare with 200 trees. They amount to 1-4.2 tons of beans in terms of crude protein.

articles.title: Slogan Showcase Patriotic Will of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Slogan Showcase Patriotic Will of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- There are revolutionary slogans written on barked trees by anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and people in the area of Mt. Paektu in Ryanggang Province, the northern part of Korea.
					 Among them are slogans written by anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung, leading a main unit of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, advanced into the Mt. Paektu area in September Juche 25 (1936) to expand the anti-Japanese armed struggle into the homeland.
					
					 Belonging to the main unit, Kim Jong Suk assisted the President in building a secret camp in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 In those days she wrote slogans on barked trees in and around the secret camp, informing other members of the unit of the importance of the secret camp.
					
					 Prompted by the President's remarks that revolutionary slogans were of significance in awakening the popular masses and encouraging them to turn out in the struggle against the Japanese imperialists, she wrote such slogans as "A general star appears above Mt. Paektu to illuminate the whole country," and "No to treatment of woman as inferior to man. Long live the women's emancipation. Let all the Korean women, ill-clad and maltreated, join in the anti-Japanese war."
					
					 Reflected in the slogans is her patriotic call for respecting the President as the sun of the nation and turning out in the struggle for national liberation under his leadership.
					
					 The slogans are still inspiring the Korean army and people in the struggle for the defence of socialism and in the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: KCNA Refutes Misinformation of Japanese Newspapers
articles.content:
KCNA Refutes Misinformation of Japanese Newspapers
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Sankei Shimbun and Yomiuri Shimbun are busy spreading wild rumors, echoing the diatribes of the Japanese right-wing reactionaries to exclude at any cost the Korean schools under the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) from the government's tuition-free program for senior high schools. 
					 Sankei Shimbun claimed that the application of the above-said program to the Korean schools means "providing Japan's public funds to the schools under the DPRK's system" while Yomiuri Shimbun complained that "the Korean schools have strong ties with Chongryon," asserting that "the funds to be given to those schools under that program should not be illegally remitted to the DPRK".
					
					 As already known, the Korean schools in different parts of Japan have enrolled all the children of Koreans in Japan to help them grow to be persons of intellect having national consciousness and qualifications required by a modern society and strictly observed the same laws and regulations regarding the contents of education and operation of schools as other foreign schools have done. 
					
					 The Koreans in Japan have the same obligation to pay taxes as the Japanese people do. Therefore, it is quite clear that the Japanese authorities should naturally give a share of them to the national education of Koreans in Japan. 
					
					 The Japan Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology might have worked out a budget on the premises that the tuition-free program is applied to the Korean schools as is the case with Japanese senior high schools and other foreign schools. 
					
					 But the application of the above-said program to Korean schools expected to take effect from April was put on hold due to the opposition from the anti-DPRK conservative forces. Prompted by the stand that the application of this program should be considered in the light of "a mere education system," the ministry has set about finally settling the issue in the direction of lifting the measure for excluding the Korean schools from the program.
					
					 It is precisely against this backdrop that the Japanese conservative media are getting vociferous in their smear campaign against the measure. This is naturally sparking off criticism from the international public as it is nothing but reckless acts on the part of the reactionary reptile media keen on the smear campaign against the DPRK and Chongryon. 
					
					 It is a shame on the media that they are cooperating with the ultra-right conservative forces even in the matter of educating youngsters, departing from their mission to lead social development and civilization.
					
					 Looking back on history, Sankei Shimbun and other conservative media of Japan have done every conceivable wrong, taking the lead in the Japanese reactionaries' anti-DPRK propaganda as pseudo media subservient to power. 
					
					 Lurking behind this behavior is the sinister intention of the reactionary reptile newspapers steeped in bitterness towards the DPRK and national chauvinism.
					
					 The Korean students in Japan are the descendants of the Koreans who were forcibly taken to Japan by the Japanese imperialists in the past and the Korean schools where they study are the legitimate institutions for national education operating with the permission of the Japanese government. Japan is under the obligation to legally and morally respect and ensure the right of the Korean students to national education in the light of the crimes the Japanese imperialists committed in the past and from an educational point of view.
					
					 The issue of including Korean schools in the above-said program should not be regarded as a simple financial issue of giving a petty amount of money to them or not. 
					
					 It is a matter related to the viewpoint and stand of Japan toward the overseas citizens of a sovereign state and reflects part of the present Japanese authorities' hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The Japanese conservative media's reckless diatribe oblivious of this suggests that they are disqualified to steer the times.

articles.title: S. Korean Final Report on Warship Snubbed
articles.content:
S. Korean Final Report on Warship Snubbed
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet Ministry of Defense recently released a final report on the warship "Cheonan" case which claimed again that the ship was sunk due to "underwater explosion caused by the north's torpedo attack" and opened it to the public.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This was a grave provocation to the DPRK and another charade of confrontation with the DPRK as it puts a damper on the public opinion at home and abroad aspiring after dialogue and detente.
					
					 It proves that the south Korean authorities are not willing to stop their anti-DPRK confrontation racket kicked off by them under the pretext of the "Cheonan" case but are set to escalate it.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group cooked up the above-said final report at a time when it adopted a "flexible deterrent strategy" calling for preempting an attack on the DPRK at the "meeting for overall state security review." Lurking behind this is a criminal attempt that should not be overlooked.
					
					 In other words, by escalating the confrontation war racket against the DPRK the south Korean ruling quarters seek to recover from the bitter setbacks they suffered in the diplomacy over the "Cheonan" case, weather the serious ruling crisis caused by their domestic and foreign policy failures and calm down the strong voices demanding the improved inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The situation, however, will never develop as desired by the south Korean authorities.
					
					 The south Korean ruling quarters would be well advised to bear in mind the adage "Curses come home to roost."

articles.title: WPK's Great Exploits Lauded
articles.content:
WPK's Great Exploits Lauded
Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea is leading the struggle of the army and people of the DPRK to one victory after another, taking the tradition of a great surge effected by Kim Il Sung's Korea as a powerful driving force for building a thriving nation.
					Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in an editorial.
					
					It goes on:
					
					The WPK is an experienced and seasoned staff of the revolution ushering in the great heyday of the prosperity of the country through creation and changes. The Korean people have recorded a history of great creation and changes at such speed of great advance as racing against time under the guidance of the great leader and the great party for decades.
					
					The dawn of a thriving nation broke on this land despite stern trials during the Arduous March, the forced march and the national power of Songun Korea remarkably grew stronger, a clear proof of the validity and vitality of the Party's idea of great surge.
					
					The leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il has brought about eye-opening events in various fields of the country something unprecedented in its history. It was against the background of dynamic era of great surge brought about by the WPK that Songun Korea displayed the invincible might as the country that manufactured and launched satellites and as a nuclear weapons state. It witnessed world-startling miracles one after another. It pushed back the frontiers of the latest science and technology in the field of CNC technology, succeeded in mass-producing Juche iron, fiber and fertilizers and completed the gigantic project for the reclamation of Taegyedo Tideland in the west sea, great events for its people. This is a shining reality of the country. 
					
					The nation's overall economy has been dynamically put on a Juche, modern and scientific basis, definitely placing it on the orbit of a surge and making spectacular sceneries unfold in various parts of the country to promise a rosy future of a thriving nation.
					
					The cause of building a thriving nation is sure to triumph as there are the experienced and seasoned leadership of the WPK steadily glorifying the history of the great revolutionary surge and its tradition and the inexhaustible mental power of the servicepersons and people single-mindedly united around the headquarters of the revolution.

articles.title: Koreans Called on to Struggle for Peace against War
articles.content:
Koreans Called on to Struggle for Peace against War
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) --To ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula is an urgent task for protecting the destiny of the Koreans in the north and the south and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a signed article.
					
					 The article cites facts to prove that the U.S. and south Korean warmongers have frantically escalated large-scale war exercises against the DPRK on the peninsula and in waters off it.
					
					 The reality calls on all the Koreans at home and abroad to turn out in a nationwide struggle to foil the frantic moves of the domestic and foreign warmongers for a war of aggression against the DPRK and defend peace on the peninsula, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The struggle for peace against war presents itself as a vital issue of defusing the danger of a new war on the Korean Peninsula and protecting the security of all the Koreans.
					
					 The U.S. turned south Korea into a nuclear outpost for invading the DPRK and has stepped up the moves for a war of aggression against it with south Korea as a springboard in pursuance of the wild ambition to dominate the whole of Korea. The south Korean warmongers hell-bent on flunkeyism and sycophancy and confrontation with fellow countrymen are frantically escalating the military stand-off in a bid to harm the DPRK by force of arms, backed by foreign forces.
					
					 The reckless war moves of the warlike forces at home and abroad have created such dangerous situation on the peninsula that a war may break out any moment.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers are allowed to go on with such moves for a new war, the Koreans will suffer from it, concludes the article.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates a signed article to the 20th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Further Enhance the Role of Intellectuals in the Revolution and Construction".
					 The work comprehensively deals with the position and role of the intellectuals in the revolution and construction and tasks facing them to revolutionize and working-classize themselves and ways to do so, etc.
					
					 The validity and vitality of the Workers' Party of Korea's idea of attaching importance to intellectuals find a striking manifestation in the fact that all the intellectuals have grown to be genuine revolutionaries sharing their will and destiny with the leader and are creditably playing the role as ideological standard-bearers powerfully encouraging all the people in their drive to build a thriving nation and as outpost soldiers pushing back the frontiers of the latest science and technology, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the intellectuals in the DPRK who proudly praise the leader's personality as a great man when creating and writing even a single poem or article and dedicate themselves to studying and applying even single advanced technology as intended by him.
					
					 A dynamic general offensive for improving the standard of people's living is now under way thanks to a large contingent of intellectuals, the forerunners of the era, who produce such masterpieces of the era as light comedy "Echo of Mountain" one after another and make the spirit of bringing about uninterrupted innovation and advance prevail throughout the country.
					
					 The DPRK proudly ranked itself among the countries that manufactured and launched satellites and nuclear weapons states. This would have been unthinkable without the brave creative spirit, patriotic enthusiasm and painstaking efforts of the intellectuals of the DPRK who have grown under the care of the great party.
					
					 It is proud, indeed, that the scientists and technicians of the DPRK acquired the world supremacy in CNC technology and are dynamically pushing forward the process for placing the national economy on a Juche, modern and scientific basis.

articles.title: Probe into Truth behind "Cheonan" Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth behind "Cheonan" Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- "National Assemblymen" from opposition parties of south Korea held an emergency meeting as regards a final report on the "Cheonan" case at the Hall of "National Assemblymen" on Sept. 15 at which they demanded probe into the truth behind the case.
					 They dismissed the final report as one full of doubts, saying that the place where a witness testified he saw for himself a column of water caused by explosion was opposite to where the warship actually sank and there were abnormal traces on some blades of a screw but they remained undamaged except for being bent.  
					
					 Key data were not reflected in the report, in particular, they charged, noting that the report did not clarify where the ship was heading and how it sank, adding that not all telegraphic messages were made public.
					
					 They raised such questions that the report did not include the specification of the underwater boat which allegedly attacked the warship and its navigational route, etc. and the composition of aluminum oxide and the results of experiment conducted by the Ministry of Defense to verify it.
					
					 They urged the ministry to conduct inspection of state administration to correctly probe the truth, given that the final report presented by the ministry failed to clear people's doubts.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Marked at DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Marked at DPRK Missions
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Receptions, photo exhibitions and film shows took place at the DPRK missions in Shenyang and Hong Kong of China, Nakhodka of Russia, Libya, Nigeria, Guinea, Equatorial Guinea, Peru, the Czech Republic, Bulgaria, Austria, France and the UK and the DPRK permanent mission at the UN Office in Geneva and its international organizations and the DPRK permanent mission at the UN between Sept. 7 and 15 to celebrate the 62nd birthday of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in their venues were works of the peerlessly great persons and photos on their immortal exploits and books and photos introducing the course of victory and glory covered by the DPRK.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were "The Arch of Triumph", "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation", "Pyongyang at Night" and other Korean films.
					
					 Present at the events on invitation were personages of different circles and chiefs of organizations for the study of the Juche idea and for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in the said countries, diplomatic envoys of various countries in those countries, representatives of different countries at the UNESCO, members of the Secretariat of the UNESCO, permanent and acting representatives of various countries at the UN, the chairman of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation, the acting director-general of the UN Office in Geneva, the secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea, the deputy director-general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and other representatives of international and regional organizations.
					
					 Officials of the DPRK missions were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the functions.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Brazil
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Organizes and Guides All the Victories of Our People" was brought out in booklet by the Asa Norte Publishing House of Brazil on Sept. 13.
					 The work, published on Oct. 3, Juche 79 (1990), expounds the idea that the party's leadership provides a sure guarantee for victory of the socialist cause and the issue of developing the WPK into a revolutionary party of Juche type. It also indicates the basic way for the party to perform its mission and duty as the leading political organization, etc.

articles.title: Statement on WPK's Birthday by Mexican Personage
articles.content:
Statement on WPK's Birthday by Mexican Personage
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- Jesus Antonio Carlos Hernandez, general secretary of the Central Committee of the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, made public a statement on Sept. 6 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 The statement noted that President Kim Il Sung formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union in 1926, initiated the Juche idea at the historic Kalun meeting in 1930 and founded the Workers' Party of Korea on Oct. 10, 1945.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 In the DPRK socialism has made steady advance and the single-minded unity of the whole society been further consolidated even under the worst situation in which the world is suffering from a serious economic crisis. 
					
					 The WPK is steering socialist construction in the DPRK to victory true to the behests of Kim Il Sung, its founder.
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il is wisely leading the WPK through his Songun revolutionary guidance.
					
					 Under his leadership the WPK will achieve bigger success in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation and reunify the country.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, September 20 (KCNA) -- One March day in Juche 62 (1973) President Kim Il Sung summoned an official of a steelworks to a meeting of the Political Committee of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea.
					 At the meeting the President gave him a task to produce spoons and chopsticks and explained their sorts, shapes, sizes and output.
					
					 The official was surprised by such a trifle matter as spoons and chopsticks put on the agenda at the important meeting.
					
					 But the President regarded the matter as a crucial one related with the people's livelihood.
					
					 When the steelworks made spoons and chopsticks, he checked them and indicated their shortcomings to improve their quality.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de la banda femenina de FPIC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de la banda femenina de FPIC
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio la funcion de la banda femenina de instrumentos de viento de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea (FPIC).
					 Esta banda presento en la ocasion la musica de instrumentos de viento "Partido es regazo del General", el solo de trompeta "El General utiliza el metodo de acortar las distancias", la musica en serie de instrumentos de viento "Cancion de agradecimiento", el cuarteto de instrumentos de viento-metal "Por la unica patria", el concierto de saxofon "Vemos la gran potencia prospera", el trio de trompeta "Mas alto y mas rapido" y otras piezas.
					
					 Muy satisfecho de que las artistas de la banda femenina hayan ofrecido esta magnifica funcion de alto nivel ideo-artistico signada del espiritu de la epoca de la Corea del Songun, el Dirigente evaluo altamente los exitos logrados en la ocasion por ellas y les dio agradecimiento.
					
					Expresando la esperanza y conviccion de que la banda exaltara el poderio de la unidad de artistas militares revolucionarias manteniendo bien su peculiaridad, presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la creacion y funciones de ella.
					
					Le acompanaron en disfrutar la funcion el vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC y jefe de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Jang Song Thaek, los secretarios del CC del PTC, Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, y otros cuadros directivos del CC del PTC, el jefe de la Direccion Politica de las FPIC, Ri Pyong Sam, el general de ejercito del EPC Hyon Chol Hae y otros miembros de mando del ejercito y otras instituciones de fuerzas armadas.

articles.title: Exposicion de fotos por amistad Corea-Italia
articles.content:
Exposicion de fotos por amistad Corea-Italia
Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 20 en el Centro de Intercambio Cultural con el Extranjero de Pyongyang la ceremonia inaugural de la exposicion de fotos por la amistad Corea-Italia.
					En la ocasion participaron el vicepresidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Italia, Ryu Sung Rim, y otros miembros de esta entidad, funcionarios correspondientes, trabajadores capitalinos, los miembros de la Embajada de la Republica de Italia en Corea y los miembros de la delegacion de imprenta de los albumes conmemorativos de Italia, de visita en Corea.
					
					Fueron invitados alli el embajador cubano y miembros de representaciones de organizaciones internacionales acreditados en Corea.
					
					En el acto los oradores se refirieron a que quedo inaugurada la fotohexibicion en ocasion del decimo aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la RPDC e Italia.
					
					Apuntaron que ambos paises vinieron cooperando en varios sectores incluida la cultura y expusieron la voluntad de seguir esforzandose tambien en el futuro por el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad.
					
					Los participantes pasaron revista a las fotos que dan a conocer la historia, la cultura, etc. de los dos paises.

articles.title: ATCC critica a los periodicos japoneses
articles.content:
ATCC critica a los periodicos japoneses
 Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ATCC) -- En estos dias, los rotativos japoneses Sankei Shimbun y Yomiuri Shimbun difunden versiones erroneas sumandose a la campana de los reaccionarios derechistas de Japon para excluir a toda costa las escuelas coreanas de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon) de la lista de las escuelas superiores donde se imparte gratuitamente la educacion a expensas del gobierno.
					 Sankei Shimbun senalo que la educacion gratuita en las escuelas coreanas "significa invertir los fondos publicos en las escuelas pertenecientes al sistema del Norte de Corea". Yomiuri Shimbun reporto a su vez que las "escuelas coreanas mantienen los lazos fuertes con la Chongryon y que los subsidios para la educacion gratuita nunca deben ser remitidos por via ilicita al Norte de Corea".
					
					  Como esta conocido, las escuelas coreanas en distintas localidades de Japon vinieron admitiendo a todos los hijos de los compatriotas coreanos residentes en Japon con el fin de formar al personal competente dotado de conciencia nacional y cualidades convenientes a la demanda de la sociedad moderna y en estricto apego a los reglamentos que rigen por igual en otras escuelas de extranjeros en cuanto al contenido didactico y a la operacion de la escuela.
					
					  Los coreanos residentes en Japon tienen al igual que los habitantes japoneses la obligacion de pagar los impuestos. Por lo tanto, resulta logico que las autoridades japonesas asignen los fondos correspondientes a la educacion nacional de los coreanos residentes en su pais.
					
					 De ahi que desde el principio, el Ministerio de Educacion, Cultura, Deporte, Ciencia y Tecnologia habia elaborado su presupuesto con la premisa de aplicar el sistema de subsidio tambien a las coreanas como hace con las escuelas superiores nacionales y las extranjeras. 
					
					 Debido a la oposicion de las fuerzas conservadoras anti-RPDC, no pudo entrar en vigor el plan de subsidiar las escuelas coreanas desde abril.
					
					  Pero, partiendo de la concepcion de que "la gratificacion docente debe ser analizada como mero problema de educacion", el Ministerio de Educacion, Cultura, Deporte, Ciencia y Tecnologia ha entrado en la coordinacion final en el sentido de cancelar la medida de excluir las escuelas coreanas de la lista de las subsidiadas.
					
					  Justamente en estos momentos, los medios de prensa conservadores de Japon, enloquecidos por las maniobras anti-RPDC y anti-Chongryon, actuan desesperadamente para mantener vigente esa medida levantando la censura de la sociedad internacional.
					
					  Es una verguenza que esos periodicos venales se sumaran a las fuerzas conservadoras y ultraderechistas hasta en el problema de educacion de las generaciones venideras desviandose de su mision de encauzar el desarrollo y la civilizacion de la sociedad.
					
					 Historicamente, los medios de prensa conservadores de Japon como Sankei Shimbun, enviciados de la hostilidad a la RPDC, la xenofobia y la aduloneria al poder, siempre estuvieron en la primera linea de la demagogia anti-RPDC de los reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					  Los estudiantes coreanos residentes en Japon son los descendientes de los coreanos que habian sido arrestados y llevados por la fuerza a Japon por los imperialistas japoneses. Y sus escuelas coreanas son legitimas instituciones de educacion nacional que se operan bajo la autorizacion del gobierno japones.
					
					 Tanto en vista de los crimenes de los imperialistas japoneses cometidos en el pasado contra el pueblo coreano como desde el punto de vista pedagogico, Japon debe respetar y asegurar legal y moralmente los derechos a la educacion nacional de los alumnos coreanos.
					
					 El subsidio a las escuelas coreanas no es un simple problema financiero, sino es un asunto relacionado con la posicion y punto de vista de Japon sobre los ciudadanos de un Estado soberano en ultramar. A la larga, este tema deviene una parte de la politica hostil a la RPDC del actual gabinete japones.
					
					 Si los medios de prensa conservadores de Japon se han puesto tan irracionales que ya no pueden juzgar lo que pueden decir y lo que no deben, no tendrian ya la calificacion de guiar la epoca que tiene la prensa.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela intencion criminal de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela intencion criminal de autoridades surcoreanas
 Pyongyang, 20 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el titere Ministerio de Defensa Nacional del Sur de Corea dio a la publicidad el informe final sobre el caso de hundimiento de la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan", en el cual volvio a insistir en que este accidente se debio a la "explosion submarina causada por el ataque de torpedo norcoreano". 
					  Esta payasada por el enfrentamiento con la RPDC deviene una grave provocacion a esta y desalienta la opinion publica interna y externa que demanda el dialogo y el alivio de la tension.
					
					 Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este lunes y prosigue:
					
					 La publicacion de dicho informe da lo mismo que anunciar que las autoridades surcoreanas tienen la voluntad de continuar con la campana conflictiva anti-RPDC iniciada so pretexto del caso del "Cheonan".
					
					 Hay un insoslayable intento criminal detras de la publicacion del informe final que coincide con la "estrategia de disuasion activa" presentada en la "reunion de revision general de la seguridad estatal" con el fin de asestar el ataque preventivo contra la RPDC. 
					
					  Es decir, al intensificar la campana conflictiva y belica contra la RPDC, las fuerzas gobernantes surcoreanas tratan de reparar su fracaso diplomatico sufrido en el caso del "Cheonan", salir de la seria crisis de gobernacion creada como producto de su frustrada politica exterior e interior y apaciguar la opinion publica que demanda la mejora de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					 Pero, la situacion no saldra como esperan las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					Ellas deben recordar este proverbio "Caerse en su propia trampa".
